description:
Our computational challenges are so big, complex and unique we can't just purchase off-the-shelf hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. Your team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. As a Hardware Engineer, you design and build the systems that are the heart of the world's largest and most powerful computing infrastructure. You develop from the lowest levels of circuit design to large system design and see those systems all the way through to high volume manufacturing. Your work has the potential to shape the machinery that goes into our cutting-edge data centers affecting millions of Google users.

As a RF Desense Hardware Engineer, you will be responsible for achieving high quality RF system-level performance by designing for desense, testing for desense and debugging desense issues for Pixel phones.

You will work cross-functionally with Electrical Engineer Designers, RF Engineers, Antenna Engineers, Product Designers, CAD designers, Software Engineers, Compliance Engineers, and ATE Engineers to validate, improve, and deliver products from concept to mass production, as well as product sustaining. You will train Hardware Test Engineers/Technicians in verification tests. You will also review results and communicate with the cross-functional team to ensure the best quality of the product is achieved.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Hardware team researches, designs, and develops new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, more powerful, and seamless. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, our Hardware team is making people's lives better through technology.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • BS degree in Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience in RF design/verification for wireless consumer electronics.
  • Hands-on experience for RF/wireless test equipment, such as; wireless communication (e.g. R&S, Anritsu, Litepoint, Keysight, etc) and general RF test equipment (e.g. Spectrum Analyzer, Network analyzer, Signal generator, and general RF components).

Preferred qualifications:

  • MS degree in Electrical Engineering.
  • Knowledge of EM theory, antenna theory and radiated measurements.
  • Knowledge in multiple wireless technologies, including cellular, WiFi, Bluetooth, GPS and NFC.
  • Familair with general Over The Air (OTA) chambers (e.g. ETS chambers, reverb chambers, satimo chambers etc).
  • Test automation and scripting capability.
responsibilities:
• Design and test for Desense performance. Debug RF desense issues.
  • Design RF desense test system and optimize test methodology, accuracy and speed.
  • Define verification matrix and internal specification for desense performance of wireless consumer hardware products.
  • Author test plans for both in-house verification and factory tests. Oversee their execution and generate status and test reports.
  • Collaborate with other engineers in design verification, troubleshooting, failure analysis, and optimization to resolve the issues and improve RF desense performance.
title: RF Desense Hardware Engineer
